title: Firefox crashed and crash popup window froze - wouldn't allow me to uncheck authorization box
content:
Hello,

Firefox recently crashed and a popup window appeared asking if I wanted to restart, and there was a box that was already checked allowing my authorization to report the incident and allowing Mozilla to use the results of the crash to help make Firefox better. I tried to uncheck the box, as I prefer to not share the information, but the window was frozen, and I had to cycle the power in my laptop to reinitialize Firefox.

Given the instability with the crash and the frozen window I'm not sure if the incident ended up being reported or not, but I didn't authorize that the incident be reported and I don't authorize Mozilla to use the information in any way. I would appreciate it if you could help to ensure that my information remains private. Security is one of the main reasons that I use Firefox.

Thanks, Rob Reiner
creator: Rob_reiner

title: Bottom portion of video in full screen are visible in the taskbar (when using Alt + Tab)
content:
Hello there!

I am facing an issue with Full Screen mode on Firefox. For example I watch a video on YouTube (Full Screen) and press Alt + Tab to change to some other app. The portion of video is visible in the taskbar of Windows. (It is visible on Linux tho too).

Thank you :)


Software Info: 1. Windows 10 2. Firefox 96.0.3
creator: 4lbllv0k

title: Declare a custom theme "light"
content: As of recently, Firefox adapts some elements (basically everything in the toolbar, like the downloads or browsing history) depending on whether it identifies the theme you use as light or dark. I am using a custom theme (this one: https://addons.mozilla.org/de/firefox/addon/tardis/?utm_source=addons.mozilla.org&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=search) that Firefox identifies as dark, however I absolutely hate any form of dark mode. So far I figured out how to force Firefox to use a light theme everywhere else using about:config, but I couldn't figure out how to change the abovementioned elemtents back to light without changing the theme. So is there any way to declare a theme as light or some other way to change this behavior?
creator: frasiwa
